intro: Torilis bifrons, commonly known as the twin-lobed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20–50 cm, with alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers, which bloom in the summer, consist of yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale yellow ray florets. Torilis bifrons is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas, and is considered a common weed in some regions.
